party package¶

Submodules¶

party.library_checking module¶

Parts library checks

party.library_checking.check_all(json_filename)[source]¶

Perform every possible test on the library

Parameters:json_filename (str) – Path to the JSON file that describes the parts library
Returns:bool : True if the library is OK, False otherwise errors : dict (keys: part_identifier, values: list of broken rules)
Return type:tuple(bool, errors)
party.library_checking.check_library_fields(json_filename)[source]¶

Check that every entry in the ‘data’ section if the library JSON file has the same fields (order does not matter)

Parameters:json_filename (str) – Path to the JSON file that describes the parts library
Returns:bool : True if the library is OK, False otherwise errors : dict (keys: part_identifier, values: list of broken rules)
Return type:tuple(bool, errors)
party.library_checking.check_library_json_rules(json_filename)[source]¶

Check that the entries in the ‘data’ field of a library respect the rules defined in the ‘rules’ field of the library

Parameters:

json_filename (str) – Path to the JSON file that describes the parts library
Returns:

bool : True if the library is OK, False otherwise errors : dict (keys: part_identifier, values: list of broken rules)
Return type:

tuple(bool, errors)
Raises:
  • NameError if the rules definition contain wrong identifiers
  • SyntaxError if there is a syntax error in the rules definition
party.library_checking.check_library_units_definition(json_filename)[source]¶

Test that each field of a data entry is referenced in the ‘units’ section of the library.json file

Parameters:json_filename (str) – Path to the JSON file that describes the parts library
Returns:bool : True if the library is OK, False otherwise errors : dict (keys: part_identifier, values: list of broken rules)
Return type:tuple(bool, errors)

party.library_creation module¶

The library_creation.py module contains standard mechanisms to create a library.json file from standard templates

Currently implemented:

  • alias mechanism : replace aliases by the values they refer to
  • generator code : replace the {{ generators }} tag in the template by the code

found in the generators subdirectory

Every function has a file_in and a file_out parameter that can be used by the specific library.json creation routines as required

party.library_creation.autocreate_library(template_file, library_file_name='library.json', delete_intermediate=True)[source]¶

Automated parts library creation from a template file. The template processing is automated depending on the presence of certain features in the template

Parameters:
  • template_file (str) – Path to the template file
  • library_file_name (str, optional (default is ‘library.json’)) – Name of the final library file
  • delete_intermediate (bool, optional (default is True)) – Should the intermediate files for library creation be deleted
party.library_creation.create_skeleton(base_folder)[source]¶

Create a skeleton for a parts library project

Parameters:base_folder (str) – The path to the base folder of the library
party.library_creation.has_aliases(d)[source]¶

Checks if a dictionnary has values with the __alias__ string

Parameters:d (dict) –
Returns:
Return type:bool
party.library_creation.template_handle_aliases(file_in, file_out)[source]¶

Replace aliases found in a template file by the values they refer to

Parameters:
  • file_in (str) – Path to the input file (i.e. a template using aliases)
  • file_out (str) – The output file (i.e. a template with replaced aliases or the final file)
party.library_creation.template_handle_generators(file_in, file_out)[source]¶
Replace the {{ generators }} tag by geometry generation code using
Python generator files in the generators subdirectory
Parameters:
  • file_in (str) – Path to the input file (i.e. a template containing a {{ generators )} tag)
  • file_out (str) – The output file (i.e. a template with replaced {{ generators }} tag or the final file)
party.library_creation.template_handle_includes(file_in, file_out)[source]¶

Replace includes found in a template file by the values they refer to

Parameters:
  • file_in (str) – Path to the input file (i.e. a template using includes)
  • file_out (str) – The output file (i.e. a template with replaced includes or the final file)
party.library_creation.template_handle_nomenclature(file_in, file_out)[source]¶

Replaces the part_ids by the nomenclature computed id

Parameters:
  • file_in (str) – Path to the input file (i.e. a template containing a {{ generators )} tag)
  • file_out (str) – The output file (i.e. a template with replaced {{ generators }} tag or the final file)

party.library_documentation module¶

library_documentation.py module

Generate the documentation for a parts library JSON file

party.library_documentation.create_libraries_sphinx_sources(libraries_root_folder, doc_folder)[source]¶

Create the sphinx files that are common to all libraries

Parameters:
  • libraries_root_folder (str) – Path to the root folder of libraries
  • doc_folder (str) – Path to the folder where the documentation should be generated

party.library_use module¶

Unique geometry script generation logic from a JSON parts library file

party.library_use.generate(json_library_filepath, generate_steps=False, generate_stls=False, generate_htmls=False)[source]¶

Create a geometry generation script for each part defined in the JSON file passed as a parameter

Parameters:
  • json_library_filepath (str) – The path to the JSON file describing the parts library
  • generate_steps (bool) –
  • generate_stls (bool) –
  • generate_htmls (bool) –
Raises:

KeyError
party.library_use.generate_all(base_folder, preview=False, generate_steps=False, generate_stls=False)[source]¶

For each folder containing a JSON parts library definition: - check the JSON file is OK - if so, generate the geometry scripts

Parameters:
  • base_folder (str) – The root folder from which to generate
  • preview (bool) – If True, do everything but creating the geometry scripts If False, also generate the geometry scripts
  • generate_steps (bool) –
  • generate_stls (bool) –

party.scripts_checking module¶

party.templating module¶

Functions for templates handling

party.templating.reconstruct_script_code_template(generator_code)[source]¶

Reconstruct a valid Python code from the generator code stored in the JSON library definition file.

Parameters:generator_code (list) – List of ccad python instructions (containing Jinja placeholders)
Returns:
  • str (the reconstructed code, including import)
  • and an if __name__ == ‘__main__’ idiom
party.templating.render(template_path, context)[source]¶

Render a template using a context

Parameters:
  • template_path (str) – Full path to a template
  • context (dict) – Dict used for template rendering
Returns:
Return type:

The template rendered with the context
party.templating.to_json_string(generators_dict)[source]¶

Transform a dictionnary of generators (key = file name no extension; value = file content) to a json string

Parameters:generators_dict (dict) – Dictionnary of generators. The key is the file name without the extension; the value is the generator file content
Returns:str – library_template.json
Return type:the json string that will replace the {{ generators }} tag in
